DataElement.preferredName: Metastatic And/Or Recurrent Malignant Neoplasm Tissue Sample Human Cancer Models Initiative Case Study Collection Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the number of metastatic/recurrent tissue biospecimen samples

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Metastatic And/Or Recurrent Malignant Neoplasm Tissue Sample Human Cancer Models Initiative Case Study Collection
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site._Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid._The reemergence of a malignant neoplasm after a period of remission._A piece of tissue removed from an organism for examination, analysis, or propagation._A collaboration between the National Cancer Institute, Cancer Research UK, the Wellcome Trust Sanger Institute, and the foundation Hubrecht Organoid Technology to generate new models of cancer that more accurately represent human tumors than existing cell line models._An uncontrolled observational study containing a detailed report of the diagnosis, treatment, and follow-up of an individual patient. Case reports also contain some demographic information about the patient (for example, age, gender, ethnic origin)._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Metastatic And/Or Recurrent Malignant Neoplasm Tissue Sample
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.:Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.:The reemergence of a malignant neoplasm after a period of remission.:A piece of tissue removed from an organism for examination, analysis, or propagation.

Concepts.definition: A term referring to the clinical or pathologic observation of a tumor extension from its original site of growth to another anatomic site.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
The reemergence of a malignant neoplasm after a period of remission.
A piece of tissue removed from an organism for examination, analysis, or propagation.

Property.preferredName: Human Cancer Models Initiative Case Study Collection
Property.preferredDefinition: A collaboration between the National Cancer Institute, Cancer Research UK, the Wellcome Trust Sanger Institute, and the foundation Hubrecht Organoid Technology to generate new models of cancer that more accurately represent human tumors than existing cell line models.:A detailed report of the diagnosis, treatment, and follow-up of an individual patient. Case reports also contain some demographic information about the patient (for example, age, gender, ethnic origin).:The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.

Concepts.definition: A collaboration between the National Cancer Institute, Cancer Research UK, the Wellcome Trust Sanger Institute, and the foundation Hubrecht Organoid Technology to generate new models of cancer that more accurately represent human tumors than existing cell line models.

An uncontrolled observational study containing a detailed report of the diagnosis, treatment, and follow-up of an individual patient. Case reports also contain some demographic information about the patient (for example, age, gender, ethnic origin).
The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Concepts linked to Tissue Banking and Pathology activities

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The quantity of the specified item.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

Concepts.definition: Determining the number or amount of something.
